intro: Kalimeris canescens, commonly known as the gray chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Kalimeris canescens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its aesthetic appeal and hardy nature.
